column3: Rama appreciates Hanuma and embraces him
Rama requests Hanuma to describe Lanka in detail
Rama fixes an auspicious hour for the departure
Sri Rama recollects the lotus-eyed Seetha
Ravana calls a meeting of his ministers
Vibhishana advises Ravana to restore Seetha
Ravana goes again to the assembly hall
Ravana instructs Prahasta to defend Lanka
Vibhishana informs about the power of Rama's arrow
Ravana refuses to hear the words of Vibhishana
Vibhishana seeks refuge at Rama's feet
Ravana sends Shuka to Sugrīva as ambassador
Rama becomes angry at the ocean
Sea-god advises Rama to build a bridge
Rama explains the various portents to Lakshmana
Rama orders the release of Shuka
Shuka explains the enemy’s army strength to Ravana
Ravana enquires about the various monkey leaders
Sharana describes the strength of the commanders
Rama enters Lanka from Suvela Mountain
Seetha sees illusory head and bow
Seetha asks Sarama about Ravana’s decision
Rama decides to stay on Suvela Mountain
Rama and others see charming garden on Suvela
Sugreeva leaps at Ravana on sighting him
Ravana commands his army to commence combat
Duels begin between monkeys and demons
Two scions of Raghu dynasty fall
Ravana applauds his son’s daring act
Seetha's anguish about Rama and Lakshmana
Garuda, the king of birds, appears
Dhumraksha and his army attack monkeys
Ravana asks Prahasta to go to battle
Ravana himself appears on the battlefield
Ravana sends demons to wake Kumbhakarna
Angada reassures the monkeys to return to battle
Ravana's grief over his brother’s death
Kumbha's brother, Nikumbha, faces the battle
Ravana instructs Indrajit to enter battlefield
Indrajit places illusory image of Seetha
Seetha has been killed by Indrajit (illusory)
Rama sends Lakshmana to kill Indrajit
Fierce battle between Lakshmana and Indrajit
Lakshmana and others treated by Sushena
Ravana distressed over his son’s death
Rama directs Vibhishana to conduct obsequies for Ravana
Hanuma informs Seetha about Rama's victory
Rama disowns her and asks her to seek shelter
Gods reach Lanka and approach Rama
The fire-god appears from the burning pyre
Lord Shiva informs Rama about his father
Rama prepares to leave for Ayodhya

column4: Lakshmana and Seetha ascend the aerial car

column3: Rama lands at Sage Bharadwaja’s hermitage
Hanuma informs Bharata about Rama’s return
Hanuma recounts to Bharata about Rama in forest
Bharata commands reception of Rama in Ayodhya
